senses.ex: This tool is primarily used to cut wood

Tips.title: Primary Use
Tips.description: Emphasize the main use or purpose of something, but not its only use.
Tips.example: The hall is primarily a concert venue, though it also hosts conferences.

Tips.title: Precedence in Importance
Tips.description: Indicate that one thing is most important among others, though others may still be significant.
Tips.example: Our strategy is primarily focused on quality, but speed is also a concern.

Tips.title: Contrast of Priorities
Tips.description: Shows contrast when one thing takes priority over another possibly expected option.
Tips.example: She is primarily an actress, not a singer.

senses.ex: Primarily, the project was aimed at helping children

Tips.title: Starting Point
Tips.description: Refers to the initial intent or position before other factors were considered.
Tips.example: Primarily, we considered location when choosing the office.

Tips.title: Historical Context
Tips.description: Indicates the original purpose or role something had when it first began.
Tips.example: The building was primarily a factory, before becoming a museum.

Tips.title: Core Objective
Tips.description: Highlights the most fundamental goal or rationale behind an action or plan.
Tips.example: The policy was primarily designed to reduce pollution.

Chief.wordDefinition:
Chief refers to the leader or head of a group or organization.

It describes a person who has the most important or influential position in a group. For example, the chief executive officer of a company is the person who makes the most important decisions for that company.

Chief describes a person in charge, while primarily describes the main focus or purpose of something.

Essential.wordDefinition:
Essential means something that is absolutely necessary, crucial or vital for something to function properly. It's often used to describe something that is needed to survive or to achieve a particular goal.

For example, in a recipe for chocolate cake, the essential ingredients include flour, sugar, eggs, and chocolate. Without these ingredients, the cake would not turn out correctly.

Essential describes things that are necessary, while primarily describes the main aspect or reason for something.

Fundamental.wordDefinition:
Fundamental means something that is essential or basic, while primarily means something that is the main or most important thing.

For example, in science, the fundamental principles of the universe are things like gravity and the laws of thermodynamics.

Fundamental refers to things that are essential or basic, while primarily refers to things that are the main focus or most important.

Initial.wordDefinition:
Initial refers to something that happens at the beginning, or at the start of something. It's often used to describe a first step or early actions.

For example, you might use initial to describe the first few days of a job or the first steps of a project.

So, in short, initial refers to something that happens at the beginning while primarily refers to something that is the main focus or primary focus.

Largely.wordDefinition:
Largely means mostly or mainly, while primarily means mainly or chiefly. Both indicate that something is the most important or significant aspect, but largely implies that there may be some other factors involved as well, while primarily suggests that there is only one main factor.

For example, you could say that your success in school is largely due to your hard work, but your success in sports is primarily due to your natural ability.

Main.wordDefinition:
Main means the most important or significant thing, while primarily means mainly or mostly.

For example, in a recipe, the main ingredient might be chicken, while other components like vegetables are primarily used to add flavor and nutrition.

In a conversation about someone's career, the main focus might be on their current job, while primarily discussing their past experiences and education that led them to where they are.

Main describes the most important or prominent object or idea, while primarily describes something that is the primary or main focus but not necessarily the most important thing overall.

Predominant.wordDefinition:
Predominant means something that is the most important, most frequent or most noticeable among a group or thing. For example, if most of the people in a room are wearing blue, then blue is the predominant color.

Predominant describes something that is most noticeable among a group of things, while primarily describes the main idea or focus of something.

Principal.wordDefinition:
Principal means the most important or leading.

For example, "The principal reason for his success was his hard work." This means that hard work was the most important or leading reason among other factors that contributed to the person's success.

Primarily is used to indicate predominance or focus, while principal is used to indicate importance or priority.

quotes.Text: The design of the Mac wasn't what it looked like, although that was part of it. Primarily, it was how it worked. To design something really well, you have to get it. You have to really grok what it's all about. It takes a passionate commitment to really thoroughly understand something, chew it up, not just quickly swallow it.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Steve Jobs

quotes.Text: I was raised primarily by women. I had a mother who almost killed herself to survive, I had a sister who was eight years older who was like a second mother, and my mother had two sisters. In the environment I grew up in, I heard a lot of female perspectives.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: James L. Brooks

quotes.Text: I believe that we have been doing this not primarily to achieve riches or even honour, but rather because we were interested in the work, enjoyed doing it and felt very strongly that it was worthwhile.
quotes.Title: English Scientist
quotes.Name: Frederick Sanger

quotes.Text: I am an artist, and I will always be working. But a film should match my personality and should be primarily based on a woman for me to go forward with it.

quotes.Text: Anyone in public life who comes out, comes out primarily for themselves, and their life is immediately improved. That's what happened to me.

quotes.Text: I think it's important that we as athletes do whatever we can to help kids, primarily helping kids of color.

quotes.Text: The scientist is motivated primarily by curiosity and a desire for truth.

quotes.Text: Man is primarily governed by passion and instinct.

quotes.Text: The rich support the poor primarily via taxes.
